resources.string: Date
%1s<font color="#B00020"> *</font>
%1s<font color="#B00020"> **</font>
Ask if Patient has any of these Symptoms
Part B1: Early Detection
Part B2: Women Only
Part B3: Elderly Specific
What is your age?
Do you smoke or consume smokeless products such as gutka or khaini?
Do you consume alcohol daily?
Measurement of waist (in cm)
Do you undertake any physical activities for minimum of 150 minutes in a week?
Do you have a family history (any one of your parents or siblings) of high blood pressure, diabetes and heart disease?
Note :
* If “Yes” is selected for any one of the questions below with “*” then show pop up message “Refer to MO and collect the Sputum sample”
** If “Yes” is selected for any one of the questions below with “**” then show pop up message “Refer to MO orinform ANM/MPW to tracing of all family members”
Select …
Anyone in family currently suffering from TB
Are you currently taking anti-TB drugs
History of TB
Coughing more than 2 weeks
Blood in sputum
Fever for > 2 weeks
Loss of weight
Night Sweats
Recurrent ulceration on palm or sole
Recurrent tingling on palm(s) or sole (s)
Cloudy or blurred vision
Difficulty in reading
Pain in eyes lasting for more than a week
Redness in eyes lasting for more than a week
Difficulty in hearing
Shortness of breath
History of fits
Difficulty in opening mouth
Ulcers/patch/growth in mouth that has not healed in two weeks
Any change in the tone of your voice
Any Growth in the mouth that has not healed in 2 weeks
Any white or red patch in the mouth that has not healed in 2 weeks
Pain while chewing
Any hyper pigmented patch or discoloration on skin with loss of sensation
Any thickend skin
Any nodules on skin
Recurrent numbness on palm(s) or sole(s)
Clawing of fingers in hand(s) or Feet
Tingling or Numbness in hands and or Feet
Inability to close eyelid
Difficulty in holding objects with fingers
Weakness in feet that causes difficulty in walking
Lump in the breast
Blood stained discharge from the nipple
Change in shape and size of breast
Bleeding between periods
Bleeding after menopause
Bleeding after intercourse
Foul smelling vaginal discharge
Yes
No
Part C: Risk factor for COPD
Occupational exposure
Part D: PHQ2
Over the last two weeks how often have you been bothered by the following problems ?
Little interest or pleasure in doing things ?
Feeling down, depressed, & hopeless ?

string-array.name: cbac_smoke
string-array.item: Used to consume in the past sometime

string-array.item: At least 150 minutes in a week

string-array.name: cbac_type_occupational_exposure
string-array.item: Working in industries with smoke, gas and dust exposure such as brick kilns and glass factories etc.
